intro: Zeugites americanus, commonly known as the American zeugite, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. Zeugites americanus thrives in wetland habitats and is often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds.
